name: Liono - box of books (40 copies)
description: Ideal gift for groups of children (5 years+) A 50% discount for schools, clubs, shops, distributors or individuals. One box contains 40 copies of 'Liono, the little lion who loves flowers' and will make and ideal gift for classes or large groups of children. This offer is currently available only in the UK. For international orders please contact the sales team here: sales@showcaseuk.tv Guaranteed two day delivery after dispatch. About Liono - Nine new stories in one great adventure! A little lion goes hunting for a wonderful plant and discovers himself. In Eamon Nancarrow’s second book 'Liono the little lion who loves flowers' you’ll find a charming collection of stories that will make people laugh, ponder about life’s encounters and just maybe bring a tear to your eye. Featuring characters like 'Petie the Pole Cat' and 'Charlie the Cheetah' this engaging tale was inspired by the drawings of Eamon’s five year old son Teelin, who spent many happy hours sketching scenes that starred his favourite cuddly toy ‘Liono’. Together father and son have created an adventure that revolves around Liono's feelings about being different: his mane is not the same colour, he would rather play with the other animals instead of hunting them and he just loves flowers. When his mum tells him of a bloom that is named after lions, Liono feels compelled to find it. And so starts a journey that will appeal to children who have started reading short stories and those who still enjoy being read to.

Expect delivery late June, early July if not earlier.

name: Holywood Star by Eamon Nancarrow (new cover)
description:
Think of it this way: 99% of musicians don't make it and this is their story.

Written by Belfast rock singer Eamon Nancarrow its his hilarious account of the misadventures he encountered during his formative years living in Holywood, County Down and then after moving to London.

On his journey he met some wonderful people, with very funny consequences and all of it was surrounded by rock music.

To celebrate its first anniversary a brand new cover was added to Eamon's great misadventure  but  inside you will still find all the stories that have made readers laugh out loud.

'Holywood Star: the life and times of a rock and roll misadventurer' by Eamon Nancarrow and published by Showcase UK

name: Holywood Star by Eamon Nancarrow (original cover)
description:
This is Eamon Nancarrow's autobiography in the original cover. 

Holywood Star is the tale of a kid brought up on a council estate just outside Belfast who dreams of striding the stages of the world's great concert halls, but at almost every step calamity trips him up. 

You won't have heard of Eamon or any of his bands, but by the end of his book you'll feel like a life-long fan.

name: Point to Point by Tom Ashford
description:
The debut album from this young UK composer is the soundtrack to a film yet to be made.

'Point to Point' is a mini action adventure in which the chase begins after an ambush in the jungle. Our hero flees into Volcano City where he has to avoid an ancient hidden society.

He stumbles upon the 'Complex' and steals a deadly item. The chase then continues through the laboratories of this mysterious annex until he finds himself on the volcano's slopes, facing certain death. 

Will he survive? Or is it game over?

As you can see below the track listing follows the plot and Tom Ashford has really captured the mood and drama of the action.

This CD is a limited edition release of 50 copies.

1. Point to Point (Main theme)
2. Jungle Chase
3. Volcano City
4. Infiltrating the base
5. Snow and Sunshine
6. In the game
